perturbation.original_text:
3.5 Payment for Milestones. Stryker shall pay to Conformis the following milestone payments for the development
work to be conducted hereunder if and when the following milestones are met, as follows:
(a) Milestone #1 - Within thirty (30) days following the date on which Stryker receives the first prototype of the Patient-
Specific Instrumentation delivered to it by Conformis in accordance with the R&D Work Plan, Stryker shall pay to Conformis a
total of two million U.S. dollars ($2,000,000); and
(b) Milestone #2 - Within thirty (30) days following the date on which there is a design freeze of the Patient-Specific
Instrumentation for the KIB Product in accordance with the R&D Work Plan, Stryker shall pay to Conformis a total of three
million U.S dollars ($3,000,000).
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5 Payment for Milestones. Stryker shall pay to Conformis the following milestone payments for the development
work to be conducted hereunder if and when the following milestones are met, as follows:
(a) Milestone #1 - Within forty-five (45) days following the date on which Stryker receives the first prototype of the Patient-
Specific Instrumentation delivered to it by Conformis in accordance with the R&D Work Plan, Stryker shall pay to Conformis a
total of two million U.S. dollars ($2,000,000); and
(b) Milestone #2 - Within thirty (30) days following the date on which there is a design freeze of the Patient-Specific
Instrumentation for the KIB Product in accordance with the R&D Work Plan, Stryker shall pay to Conformis a total of three
million U.S dollars ($3,000,000).
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction. Section 3.5(a) originally stated that payment for Milestone #1 would be made within 30 days of Stryker receiving the prototype. This modification changes it to 45 days. Now there is a discrepancy in payment times for the same type of milestone. It is not clear how it should be.

perturbation.original_text:
3.6 Payment. Stryker shall make all payments to Conformis required herein by wire transfer in accordance with the Wire
Instructions. Such payments are non-refundable and non-creditable except as set forth in the Other Agreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.6 Payment. Stryker shall make all payments to Conformis required herein by wire transfer in accordance with the Wire
Instructions. Such payments are non-refundable but may be creditable at Stryker's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that payments are non-creditable except as set forth in the Other Agreements. The modified text contradicts this by stating that payments may be creditable at Stryker's sole discretion. This creates ambiguity as to whether Conformis can rely on payments being non-creditable and introduces uncertainty about whether a credit might be applied retroactively or unexpectedly.

perturbation.original_text:
8.3 Surviving Rights/Obligations.
(a) The provisions of Articles V, VI, VII and IX and Sections 8.3, 8.4, 10.1, 10.2, 10.5 - 10.13 and 10.15, together with
any provisions required for the interpretation or enforcement of any of the foregoing, shall survive the termination or expiration of
this Agreement, provided, however that Section 7.3(a)(iv) shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for only
[**] thereafter. The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve any Party from obligations that are expressly indicated to survive
termination of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.3 Surviving Rights/Obligations.
(a) The provisions of Articles V, VI, VII and IX and Sections 8.3, 8.4, 10.1, 10.2, 10.5 - 10.13 and 10.15, together with
any provisions required for the interpretation or enforcement of any of the foregoing, shall survive the termination or expiration of
this Agreement, provided, however that Section 7.3(a)(iv) shall not survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement. The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve any Party from obligations that are expressly indicated to survive
termination of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The change is in direct contradiction with the orginal excerpt. The orginal excerpt claims that Section 7.3(a)(iv) survives termination of the contract, but in the edited version, I made sure it DOES NOT survive termination. This creates an in-text contradiction and would leave the audience confused.
